quote.quotepara: I registered myself to this mailinglist because I was asked to show the modifications I made to the responsible folks of kwin. But I am happy to notice that someone (you) did this already. If there are any questions concerning my modifications just ask me.

body.para: The patch is nice, but I hesitate to add it since the "RoundCorners" feature is not one that the original IceWM includes. So what this means is:

If the "RoundCorners" feature becomes popular, themes using it won't work well as-is on IceWM since it doesn't support it. So we would essentially have a fork the IceWM theme format, which is bad. The whole idea of the engine was to use 'original' IceWM themes, not modify the engine in a way that special themes for kwin-icewm are created, that are not compatible with IceWM.

If this feature was in IceWM 1.2.x, then I'd be all for it to be added. I'll speak to Marko Macek about it, and if he agrees, I'll patch IceWM to add this so a fork of the theme format doesn't happen (and there's no need for this). There's also IceWM's expermental shaping support that kwin-icewm doesn't cater for yet, but this is on my TODO.

quote.quotepara: By the way: I also made some enhancements on the native decoration called "system" (concerning configurable buttons like in other decorations). I don't know who is responsible for that native decoration but I would be happy to show him or her my modifications.

body.para: We're going to heavily modify all the client style code for KDE 3.2 and introduce a new API for this, but if people want it in HEAD, feel free to have it there for the benefit of other developers.
